humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states 'Lymph node status: Positive 2/25.' This means that metastatic carcinoma was found in 2 out of the 25 lymph nodes that were assessed. Therefore, the N stage is N1, as per Rule 12: N1 indicates metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for a cancer patient is determined by the presence and extent of cancer involvement in the lymph nodes. In this pathology report, the patient has metastatic carcinoma present in 2 out of 25 lymph nodes, with the largest metastasis measuring 4 cm. This information supports the classification of N1 (N: lymph nodes). The specific substaging information is not provided in the report, so we ignore it for this question. The N1 stage is used when there are metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes or in infraclavicular (claviular) lymph nodes.
